1.brief: properly, to push forth; (but used only figuratively) to lash, i.e. (the sea with oars) to row; by implication, to travel
properly, separate by awall, i.e. outside, outdoors
Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
'I pray', 'now', or 'then'; added mostly to verbs (in the Imperative or Future), or to interjections, occasionally to an adverb or conjunction

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
a width, i.e. (concretely) avenue or area
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
literally firmness; figuratively security; morally fidelity

2.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)

3.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
literally firmness; figuratively security; morally fidelity
to strike (lightly or severely, literally or figuratively)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to twist or whirl (in a circular or spiral manner), i.e. (specifically) to dance, to writhe in pain (especially of parturition) or fear; figuratively, to wait, to pervert
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
properly, chastisement; figuratively, reproof, warning or instruction; also restraint
to fasten upon; hence, to seize, be strong (figuratively, courageous, causatively strengthen, cure, help, repair, fortify), obstinate; to bind, restrain, conquer
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
a craggy rock, literally or figuratively (a fortress)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

properly, dangling, i.e. (by implication) weak or thin
properly, to be slack, i.e. (figuratively) to be foolish

properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to spy out, i.e. (generally) survey, (for evil) lurk for, (for good) care for
to weave (i.e. lay) a trap; figuratively, (through the idea of secreting) to allay (passions; physically, abate a flood)
properly, entangled, i.e. by implication (intransitively) a snare, or (transitive) a snarer
to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively)
destructive, i.e. (as noun) destruction, literally (specifically a snare) or figuratively (corruption)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
to catch (in a net, trap or pit); generally, to capture or occupy; also to choose (by lot); figuratively, to cohere

27.brief: a bird-trap (as furnished with a clap-stick or treadle to spring it); hence, a basket (as resembling a wicker cage)
full (literally or figuratively) or filling (literally); also (concretely) fulness; adverbially, fully
a bird (as covered with feathers, or rather as covering with wings), often collectively
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
full (literally or figuratively) or filling (literally); also (concretely) fulness; adverbially, fully
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
properly, to accumulate; chiefly (specifically) to grow (causatively, make) rich

28.brief: to shine, i.e. (by analogy) be (causatively, make) oily or gross
probably to be sleek, i.e. glossy; hence (through the idea of polishing) to excogitate (as if forming in the mind)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a straight course, i.e. sail direct
judgement (the suit, justice, sentence or tribunal); by implication also strife
to push forward, in various senses (literal or figurative, transitive or intransitive)

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to judge, i.e. pronounce sentence (for or against); by implication, to vindicate or punish; by extenssion, to govern; passively, to litigate (literally or figuratively)

29.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to grudge, i.e. avenge or punish
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

30.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

31.brief: to prophesy, i.e. speak (or sing) by inspiration (in prediction or simple discourse)
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
literally one officiating, a priest; also (by courtesy) an acting priest (although a layman)
to tread down, i.e. subjugate; specifically, to crumble off
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity
